음..주로 단어선정에 대한 요약이군요.
디비에 단지 DB2만이 아니라, 어떠한 DBMS에 테이블이나 속성을 만들면, DBMS 내부에 정의된 명령형 단어랑 충돌되는게 있습니다. 예를들면, 위에 comment, hour, unit, user..등..만들다보니..
충돌되서.. 제 개인적으로 이름을 변경했습니다.

post.content:
I summarized my suggestions below for the tables and their relationships.
Thanks.

====================================
<courseHistory>

Reason: table naming consistency
courseHistory -> CourseHistory (or COURSE_HISTORY is more comfortable to me :-)

Reason: redundant wording
coursecomment -> comment

<course>

Reason: table naming consistency
course -> Course

Reason: redundant wording
courseTitle -> title
courseUnits -> units
courseHours -> hours
coursecomment -> comment

Reason: missing mandatory relationship with CourseType
Couse shall always have its associated CourseType - i.e. it is not optional.

<courseType>

Reason: table naming consistency
courseType -> CourseType

Reason: misleading wording
courseName -> typeName or courseTypeName

<courseReport>

Reason: table naming consistency
courseReport -> CourseReport

Reason: table name
I think we agreed to use CourseRecord.

Reason: redundant wording
courseReportComment -> comment

<student>

Reason: table naming consistency
student -> Student

Reason: redundant wording
studentType -> type
studentComment -> comment

Reason: suggestion
studentid -> studentID or studentId  (personally, i prefer studentID. The word 'ID' has been traditionally accepted and used as  'identification'. It is much like 'info' is accepted for 'information'.

DOB -> dateOfBirth (OK, I started this DOB thing, which is commonly used and understood so DOB is OK too :-)

statusinCanada -> statusInCanada

courseLanguage -> preferredLanguage (we agreed with the customer to use "preferredLanguage " at the 12/14 meeting).
appliedDiploma -> major (we agreed with the customer to use "major" at the 12/14 meeting).

<Address>

Reason: redundant wording
addressType -> type

<Education>

Reason: suggestion
program -> major  (we agreed to use "major" with the customer at the 12/14 meeting).
dateStrat ->  we agreed with the customer to get rid of this at the 12/14 meeting.
dateFinish -> graduationDate

Reason: missing mandatory relationship with Student
Education shall always have its associated Student  - i.e. it is not optional.

<consultingHistory>

Reason: table naming consistency
consultingHistory-> ConsultingHistory

Reason: missing field
consultingDate is missing.

Reason: redundant wording
historyComment -> comment

<consultant>

Reason: table naming consistency, table name suggestion
consultant -> User (even if it may be true that all the login users are considered to be potential consultants, the primary purpose of this table is for user authenticaion. one of the user roles may be 'consultant')

Reason: counter-intuitive wording
seqUserId -> userId or userID (personally, i prefer userID. The word 'ID' has been traditionally accepted and used as  'identification'. It is much like 'info' is accepted for 'information'.

Reason: redundant wording, counter-intuitive wording
usenrPassword -> password
userName -> name or fullName - i.e. first + last name (userName may be misunderstood as user ID)
flag -> active or working (flag is too general and does not suggest enough meaning)


-end
